bad-formatting: Formatting the file in any other way than indicated above may result in calculation errors.
json-crisp-text-1: The JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) file should contain two keys with values in the form of arrays: 'matrix' - a two-dimensional array with the data that will be used for the multi-criteria calculation; 'criteriaTypes' - a list with the criteria types, where -1 means cost type and 1 means profit type.
json-crisp-text-2: A valid matrix should not contain text data or blank fields. The values in each column should not be the same. Each row represents a decision option and each column represents a criterion that is considered in the problem.
json-crisp-text-3: No value other than 1 or -1 should appear in the criteria types. The number of values in the criteria types should equal the number of columns in the 'matrix'.
json-fuzzy-text-1: The JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) file should contain two keys with values in the form of arrays: 'matrix' - a three-dimensional array with the data represented as Triangular Fuzzy Numbers that will be used for the multi-criteria calculation; 'criteriaTypes' - a list with the criteria types, where -1 means cost type and 1 means profit type.
json-fuzzy-text-2: A valid matrix should not contain text data or blank fields. The values in each column should not be the same. Each row represents a decision option and each column represents a criterion that is considered in the problem. Each element should be represented as Triangular Fuzzy Number (TFN) [a, m, b], where a is a lower value of TFN, m is a middle value of TFN, and b is an upper value of TFN. The a, m, b values should be ordered ascending or be equal.
json-fuzzy-text-3: No value other than 1 or -1 should appear in the criteria types. The number of values in the criteria types should equal the number of columns in the 'matrix'.
xlsx-crisp-text-1: XLSX (Microsoft Excel) files should be formatted so that the matrix and criteria types are separated by an unfilled line with values.
xlsx-crisp-text-2: In a matrix, the rows represent the alternatives and the columns represent the criteria in the problem. Each row should contain an equal number of values.
xlsx-crisp-text-3: The criteria types represent the preferred value direction. -1 represents the cost type and a value of 1 represents the profit type. The number of values in the last row should equal the number of columns in the matrix.
xlsx-fuzzy-text-1: XLSX (Microsoft Excel) files should be formatted so that the matrix and criteria types are separated by an unfilled line with values.
xlsx-fuzzy-text-2: In a matrix, the rows represent the alternatives and the columns represent the criteria in the problem. Each row should contain an equal number of values. Each element should be represented as Triangular Fuzzy Number (TFN) [a, m, b], where a is a lower value of TFN, m is a middle value of TFN, and b is an upper value of TFN. The values a, m, b should be separated by space, not a comma.
xlsx-fuzzy-text-3: The criteria types represent the preferred value direction. -1 represents the cost type and a value of 1 represents the profit type. The number of values in the last row should equal the number of columns in the matrix.
csv-crisp-text-1: Comma-Separated Values (CSV) format files and the data they contain should be divided into two sections. The first should represent the decision matrix in the problem. The second, written after a blank line separating the sections, should represent the criteria types.
csv-crisp-text-2: The matrix represents the decision options in the rows and the criteria considered in the problem in the columns. The values in the matrix in a single row should be separated by commas, and the new row of the decision matrix should be written on a new line. The matrix should not contain empty values or text characters.
csv-crisp-text-3: The number of criteria types should equal the number of columns in the matrix. The criterion types should only be represented by the values -1 for the cost type, and 1 for the profit type. Values should be separated by commas.
csv-fuzzy-text-1: Comma-Separated Values (CSV) format files and the data they contain should be divided into two sections. The first should represent the decision matrix in the problem. The second, written after a blank line separating the sections, should represent the criteria types.
csv-fuzzy-text-2: The matrix represents the decision options in the rows and the criteria considered in the problem in the columns. The values in the matrix in a single row should be separated by commas, and the new row of the decision matrix should be written on a new line. The matrix should not contain empty values or text characters. Each element should be represented as Triangular Fuzzy Number [a, m, b], where a is a lower value of TFN, m is a middle value of TFN, and b is an upper value of TFN. The values of a, m, b should be separated by a space, not a comma. Comma should be used to separate the TFN in a single row.
csv-fuzzy-text-3: The number of criteria types should equal the number of columns in the matrix. The criterion types should only be represented by the values -1 for the cost type, and 1 for the profit type. Values should be separated by commas.
